author: mini_mads1980
title: What Do You Mean, You Don't Like Pizza!?!
review:
Overview

The Possessed Pizza Delivery Man comes attached to the front of issue 2 of the Hidden Side Comic, available between 6th November and 10th December 2019.

Packet

Unlike other comics the Hidden Side ones have started with the smaller foil bag with a flap.  This contains the pieces well, but the glue use to hold the flap down is very strong and can easily catch the pieces as you try to pour them out.

The Possessed Pizza Delivery Man is pictured nicely with his possessed face and he is brandishing his cleaver.  The 1:1 image on the back is the printed 2x2 tile representing the pizza box.  The front indicates that this is for 7+, which seems strange as Collectable Minifigures are 5+ and there is nothing different here - unless the theme is deemed to be older?

Minifigure

This set is completely about the Possessed Pizza Delivery Man.  He is basically the same as Ronny from the Hidden Side set 70422: Shrimp Shack Attack with his torso and legs being identical to Ronny's, indeed his torso only appears in this and the Shrimp Shack making it unique to the Hidden Side.  His legs are plain Earth Blue and are incredibly common.

What is great with this set is you get two head elements!  The possessed head, as you would imagine, currently only appears with Hidden Side and is in three of the sets from the theme.  The "standard" head is reasonably common, appearing in 15 sets including some of the People Packs.  The cheapest way to get this is probably through 60146: Stunt Truck.

He also sports a red hat which is very common too.

Main Build/Parts

There is no build here other than the Minifigure.  However you do get the printed 2x2 tile for the pizza box and the cleaver.  The cleaver only really appears in higher priced sets, so it's good to see it included here and the 2x2 only appears in five other sets.

Verdict

I would say that this is better than Jack from the last issue, however with no direct app use for this Minifigure it is still missing something.  It will fit nicely with the Shrimp Shack, and the standard head allows him to be used within any Lego City too.  This goes nicely with the Lego Comic set 951909 released recently, so it's a shame that they were not both available at the same time.

This only cost £3.99, which is a fantastic price when you compare it to Collectable Minifigures.

From 11th December 2019 issue three will have Parker with a laptop.  She appears to match the one in 70419: Wrecked Shrimp Boat.
